title: Correlation between Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd stock's performance and broader economic trends

content.text: Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd is a financial services institution operating primarily in Bermuda and the Cayman Islands. To analyze the correlation between its stock performance and broader economic trends, we will examine historical data and events.

During the global financial crisis of 2008, numerous financial institutions faced significant challenges. The stock prices of many banks plummeted, including Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd. This indicates a correlation between broader economic downturns and the bank's stock performance.

Changes in interest rates can have a profound impact on banks' profitability. When central banks lower interest rates, it generally stimulates economic activity and potentially increases borrowing and lending. Conversely, higher interest rates can lead to decreased demand for loans. Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd's stock performance may correlate positively with periods of economic expansion and lower interest rates.

The overall growth of a country's gross domestic product (GDP) is often associated with increased lending and economic prosperity. Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd's stock performance might exhibit a positive correlation with periods of robust GDP growth, indicating its reliance on a healthy economy.

Changes in regulatory policies, such as capital requirements or financial oversight, can have a significant impact on banks' profitability and subsequently their stock performance. For example, stricter regulations following the financial crisis may affect the bank's operations and investor confidence.

Factors specific to the banking industry, such as loan delinquencies, changes in banking technology, or shifts in customer preferences, can influence Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd's stock performance. These factors may not correlate directly with broader economic trends but can still impact the company's financials.

The stock performance of Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd is likely correlated with broader economic trends such as financial crises, interest rate changes, GDP growth, regulatory environment, and industry-specific factors. Analyzing these data-driven factors can help understand the relationship between the bank's stock performance and the overall economy.

news.headline: Butterfield Announces Share Repurchase Program
news.summary: HAMILTON, Bermuda, December 05, 2023--The Bank of N.T. Butterfield & Son Limited ("Butterfield" or the "Bank") (BSX: NTB.BH; NYSE: NTB) today announced that its Board of Directors has approved a $90 million ordinary share repurchase program ("the Share Repurchase Program") pursuant to which the Bank is authorized to purchase up to 3.5 million of its ordinary shares through December 31, 2024.
